alert.note: Alert for Prince Georges (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 10 at 5:47PM EDT until August 10 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN PRINCE GEORGES COUNTY... At 547 PM EDT, emergency management reported water rescues ongoing in the Greenbelt area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... College Park... Greenbelt... Langley Park... Beltsville... Bladensburg... University of Maryland... Landover... Hyattsville... Takoma Park... East Riverdale... Adelphi... New Carrollton... Mitchellville... Riverdale Park... Cheverly... Hillandale... Greater Landover... Goddard... Lanham-Seabrook... Silver Spring... FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Basement flooding can occur quickly and create a life-threatening situation. If you are in a basement, or a residence below street level, move to a higher floor immediately.
